title: What are the differences between actuality and fact? - Quora

response.answer_text: There isn't a difference per se, actuality is the happening, and fact would be in reference to the happening. That's implying to the same event or energy In the situation of two separate incidents, possibly the I assume a difference — in time or date?..

The noun ACTUALITY means : Something exists objectively. (In physical shape.) E.G. The existence of a ghost is not actuality, it's a belief. 'Fact' means : A piece of information about existing circumstances or events which occurred. E.G. : “ He came here yesrerday. “ is a fact.
